title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN becomes the new streaming home for MLB.TV, with fans needing ESPN's app for subscription management.
ESPN Unlimited subscribers can add MLB.TV for $134.99, while non-subscribers pay $149.99 with a free ESPN trial month.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers automatically renew; free ESPN trial is optional, not mandatory for continued access.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Celtics' G League team, signaling potential progress in his recovery.
Ron Harper Jr. noted Tatum performed well during practice, though Tatum's return this season remains uncertain.
Celtics maintain Tatum will not return until fully recovered, with no official timetable for his comeback provided.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the 2026 WalletHub study based on higher education and public school performance.
Massachusetts leads the nation with over 47% of adults holding a bachelor's degree and nearly 22% with a graduate degree.
Vermont and Maryland placed second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia were the least educated states.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: The rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card is up for auction, closing on February 21, with current bids nearing $4.8 million.
Morton Bernstein originally found the card, which has been held by his Taunton-based family for 116 years before being auctioned.
Ken Goldin, star of Netflix's 'King of Collectibles', facilitates the auction, highlighting the card's unprecedented historical and monetary value.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman will start for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman has played a key role in international tournaments, helping the USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship.
Swayman joins Bruins teammate Charlie McAvoy in representing Team USA at the upcoming Olympic preliminary game.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 3-year-old female North Atlantic right whale, the calf of whale #3293 'Porcia,' was found dead off Virginia.
The whale's death is the second right whale fatality in two weeks, highlighting the species' critical endangerment.
NOAA Fisheries and scientists will conduct a necropsy to determine the whale's cause of death amid ongoing mortality concerns.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A seventh child has died from influenza this season in Massachusetts, with 260 total flu-related deaths reported.
The Massachusetts Department of Public Health reports 253 adult and seven pediatric flu-related deaths since October 2023.
Health officials urge vaccinations as flu activity strains hospitals; cases are starting to decline in February.

title: Mass. police department offers ‘Valentine’s Day Special’ for wanted exes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Uxbridge Police Department issued a 'Valentine's Day Special' encouraging people to report ex-partners with outstanding warrants.
The humorous initiative features a heart-themed flyer offering a 'ride with flashing lights' as a special Valentine’s gift.
Similar Valentine's Day warrant reminders are used by police in New Hampshire, Ohio, Nebraska, and New York.

title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer will alternate between second and third base during Red Sox spring training practices.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora aims to solidify infield positions soon with a focus on reducing errors in 2026.
The Red Sox are evaluating a versatile pool of infield options including Romy Gonzalez and Isiah Kiner-Falefa.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Ashton Grant will remain as New England Patriots quarterbacks coach, choosing not to interview for NFL offensive coordinator roles.
Grant, former Assumption University wide receiver, played a key role in quarterback Drake Maye's successful second NFL season.
Patriots QB Maye led the NFL in completion percentage and QBR, attributing success to coaching from Grant and staff.
